intro: Oreodaphne blanchetii, commonly known as the Philippine sandpaper tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its rough, sandpapery bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It is often found in lowland to montane rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
